free_text.Learning outcomes: This course provides the fundamentals of analog IC design, starting with a deep understanding and adequate modeling of active components. Various elementary building blocks are presented, and special issues such as low-current operation and high-precision design are emphasized.
free_text.Content: 1. MOS and Bipolar: Modes of Operation and Models[br/]2. Passive Components and Parasitic Effects[br/]3. Layout Techniques for Analog Circuits[br/]4. Elementary Building Blocks[br/]5. Voltage References[br/]6. Analog Functional Blocks[br/]7. BiCMOS Analog Building Blocks[br/]8. CMOS Off-Chip Drivers[br/]9. Switched - Capacitor Circuit Design[br/]10. Future Trends in Analog ICs[br/][br/]
free_text.Keywords: Analog IC Design, MOS, Bipolar, BiCMOS

free_text.Contenu: 1. MOS and Bipolar: Modes of Operation and Models[br/]2. Passive Components and Parasitic Effects[br/]3. Layout Techniques for Analog Circuits[br/]4. Elementary Building Blocks[br/]5. Voltage References[br/]6. Analog Functional Blocks[br/]7. BiCMOS Analog Building Blocks[br/]8. CMOS Off-Chip Drivers[br/]9. Switched - Capacitor Circuit Design[br/]10. Future Trends in Analog ICs
free_text.Mots clés: Analog IC Design, MOS, Bipolar, BiCMOS

Various elementary building blocks are presented, and special issues such as low-current operation and high-precision design are emphasized.
